alert.note: Alert for Garvin; Hughes; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 6:55AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Garvin, Seminole, northern Pontotoc, southwestern Pottawatomie, Hughes and southeastern McClain Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 654 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Yeager to near Asher to near Pauls Valley. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ada, Seminole, Pauls Valley, Holdenville, Wewoka, Wynnewood, Stratford, Konawa, Wetumka, Byng, Maud, Allen, Paoli, Bowlegs, Dustin, Asher, Wanette, Francis, Calvin and Byars. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 64 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
